summary: This is an email from U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman summarizing a recorded interview with the warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding the circumstances leading up to Jeffrey Epstein's death. It details Epstein's movements between suicide watch, psychological observation, and the Special Housing Unit (SHU), and reveals failures in the protocol requiring him to have a cellmate.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Sender and author of the email summarizing the interview with the MCC warden. He is coordinating the investigation into Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who died by apparent suicide in the MCC. The document details his movements within the facility, his prior suicide attempt, and the failure to keep him with a cellmate.

persons.name: The Warden
persons.role: Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC)
persons.context: Was interviewed about the procedures and decisions regarding Epstein's incarceration, including his placement on and removal from suicide watch and the cellmate protocol.

persons.name: Dr. [Redacted]
persons.context: Briefed the warden on Epstein's condition and recommended his downgrade from suicide watch to psychological observation, stating Epstein was no longer suicidal.

persons.name: Capt. [Redacted]
persons.role: Supervisor of the SHU at MCC
persons.context: Was directed by the warden to ensure Epstein had a cellmate at all times in the SHU and confirmed he relayed these instructions to staff.

persons.name: Inmate [Redacted]
persons.context: An older inmate and cooperator who was selected to be Epstein's cellmate when he was moved back to the SHU on July 29, 2019.

persons.name: Officer [Redacted]
persons.context: A duty officer who worked the overnight shift from August 9 to August 10, 2019, in the SHU. She refused to be interviewed by the FBI and OIG.

persons.name: Officer [Redacted]
persons.context: A duty officer who worked the overnight shift from August 9 to August 10, 2019, in the SHU. He was the first person to find Epstein.

connections.description: The warden was responsible for Epstein's custody and the implementation of protocols (like suicide watch and cellmate assignment) for his safety.
The chief psychologist assessed Epstein's mental state and made the recommendation to remove him from suicide watch.
The warden relied on the psychologist's professional opinion and stated he does not second-guess medical professionals.
The warden gave direct orders to the SHU captain to ensure Epstein had a cellmate, and the captain confirmed he relayed the instructions.
The older inmate was selected to be Epstein's cellmate when Epstein was transferred back to the SHU on July 29, 2019.
The officer was on duty in the SHU during the shift when Epstein was found deceased.

events.title: Epstein's Apparent Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was involved in an incident at MCC that was treated as an apparent suicide attempt. He was moved to the suicide watch unit.

events.title: Epstein Placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: Following the apparent suicide attempt, Epstein was placed on formal suicide watch on the 2nd floor of MCC, requiring a smock and 24/7 observation by an inmate companion.

events.title: Downgraded to Psychological Observation
events.description: Epstein was downgraded from suicide watch to psychological observation on the recommendation of the chief psychologist, who stated he was no longer suicidal. He remained on the 2nd floor but wore normal clothes.

events.title: Transferred Back to SHU
events.description: Epstein was removed from psychological observation and transferred back to the Secure Housing Unit (SHU) on the 9th floor. The warden directed that he must have a cellmate at all times.

events.title: Cellmate Transferred Out
events.description: Epstein's cellmate, Inmate [Redacted], was transferred from the MCC to a GEO facility. This left Epstein without a cellmate, contrary to the warden's specific orders.

events.title: Epstein Found Deceased
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell in the SHU. Officer [Redacted] was the first to find him.

events.title: Interview of MCC Warden
events.description: The OIG, FBI, and USAO-SDNY conducted a recorded, voluntary interview with the warden of MCC regarding the events leading to Epstein's death.

keyFacts: Epstein was removed from suicide watch on or about July 24, 2019, after the chief psychologist stated he was no longer suicidal, a decision the warden did not question.
The warden gave explicit, repeated orders that Epstein must have a cellmate at all times when in the SHU, and the SHU captain confirmed he relayed these orders to staff.
Epstein's designated cellmate was transferred out of the MCC on August 9, 2019, leaving Epstein alone in his cell, and the warden was not notified of this change.
Two corrections officers working voluntary overtime shifts were on duty in the SHU the night Epstein died; one refused to be interviewed by investigators.
The document reveals a critical breakdown in communication and protocol enforcement between the warden's orders and the on-duty staff in the SHU.
